text:
“I don’t know why I did go. I am a contemptible person, Dounia.”

“A contemptible person, but ready to face suffering! You are, aren’t you?”

“Yes, I am going. At once. I thought of drowning myself, but... it’s pride, Dounia.”

“Pride, Rodya.”

He looked at her, a glimmer of fire in his eyes.

“You don’t think I was afraid of the water?” he asked, smirking.

“Oh, Rodya, hush!” she cried bitterly.

Silence filled the room. He stared at the floor. 

“It’s late. I am going to give myself up. But I don’t know why.”

Big tears fell down her cheeks.

“You are crying, sister. Can you hold out your hand to me?”

“Did you doubt it?” 

She embraced him tightly. 

“Aren’t you half expiating your crime by facing the suffering?” 

“Crime? What crime?” he shouted. “I killed a vile noxious insect!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov grapples with his feelings of contemptibility and pride as he prepares to face the consequences of his actions.
